prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: John Maynard Poythress Genealogical Notes, 1633-2012. Accession 52087. Personal papers collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Giff ot E. Dewayne and Leigh Wilson of Townsend, Tennessee

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Poythress, John Maynard (1934-2012) was born in Macon Georgia and graduated from Mercer University with a degree in English literature. He was a general manager at Inland Container where he worked for 36 years. He was married to Jean Knott Poythress for 54 years and they had children.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Papers, 1633-2012, of John Maynard Poythress (1934-2012) of Louisville, Kentucky, consisting of Poythress family genealogical research material. Papers included family descendents of Francis Poythress (d. ca. 1650) who immigrated from England about 1633. Collection includes references to early colonial Virginia families, including Francis Poythress' daughter Jane who may have married Thomas Rolfe, so of John Rolfe and Pocahontas. Research includes material referencing family branches that settled initially in Charles City County and Prince George County, Virginia; and then later settling in Georgia, with some branches in Alabama and North Carolina. Additional material relating to the Prince George County plantation Flowerdew Hundred, owned by Joshua Poythress and his descendants from 1725 to 1949, is also included. Collection contains annotated books and copies of additional sources, such as wills, deeds, censuses, and military records. Correspondence from other Poythress researchers, and extensive genealogical research notes are also included.
